intro: Hieracium cinerascens, commonly known as the ash-gray hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are yellow with a central disk. It is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
